quote: When an invading force crosses a river in its onward march, do not advance to meet it in mid-stream.Â  It will be best to let half the army get across, and then deliver your attack.
quote_letters: WHEN AN INVADING FORCE CROSSES A RIVER IN ITS ONWARD MARCH DO NOT ADVANCE TO MEET IT IN MID-STREAM IT WILL BE BEST TO LET HALF THE ARMY GET ACROSS AND THEN DELIVER YOUR ATTACK
source: Sun Tzu, The Art of War
